channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gap says Trump’s tariffs could cost the company a whopping $300 million, sending shares into a tailspin
item.description: The company behind Banana Republic and Old Navy fell 19% after saying tariffs on imports could add up to $300 million in costs.

item.title: Trump Makes a New Push to ‘Decouple’ U.S. From China
item.description: Trump administration officials are getting a second chance to try to sever ties with China by starting a trade war, imposing export controls and revok...

item.title: Removing fluoride from public water systems would result in dental disaster for millions of Americans, study warns
item.description: A new study projects what the effects of removing fluoride from water nationwide would be—and the findings are a dentist’s nightmare.

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial Continues With Testimony From Ex-Assistant ‘Mia’
item.description: The former employee, testifying under the pseudonym Mia, was the second woman to share an account of sexual abuse at trial. Mr. Combs denies sexually ...

item.title: The 13-year-old who won the Scripps National Spelling Bee almost choked at the end because he got too cocky: ‘I think he cared too much about his aura’
item.description: Faizan Zaki was two words away from victory, but let his showman instincts take over.

item.title: Supreme Court Allows Trump Administration, for Now, to End Biden-Era Migrant Program
item.description: The Trump administration had asked the court to allow it to end deportation protections for more than 500,000 people facing dire humanitarian crises i...

item.title: Hormel Foods says consumers are ‘strained’ as they trade down or hunt for value, but maintains outlook for the year
item.description: On an earnings call this week Hormel Foods said consumers are feeling strained, but are adjusting their spending habits for maximum value which may in...

item.title: Barack Obama says work-life balance isn’t real for successful people
item.description: Even former President Obama admits: you can’t have it all—at least not at once.

item.title: Elon Musk Juggled Drugs and Family Drama on Trump’s Campaign Trail
item.description: As Mr. Musk entered President Trump’s orbit, his private life grew increasingly tumultuous and his drug use was more intense than previously known.

item.title: Trump Makes a New Push to ‘Decouple’ U.S. From China
item.description: Trump administration officials are getting a second chance to try to sever ties with China by starting a trade war, imposing export controls and revok...

item.title: Landslide at Quarry in Indonesia Kills at Least 10
item.description: Officials halted rescue operations on Friday evening after poor lighting and the possibility of more landslides put rescue workers at risk.

item.title: Israel Orders Evacuation of Much of Northern Gaza, Warning of Dangerous Combat
item.description: Many in the area have already been displaced at least once during the war and little humanitarian aid is arriving amid widespread hunger.

item.title: In South Korea, Desperate Workers Take Their Grievances Into the Sky
item.description: The plight of temporary workers like Kim Hyoung-su, who’s been protesting for months at the top of a tower, has become an issue in Tuesday’s president...

item.title: Trump Accuses China of Violating Trade Agreement
item.description: President Trump said that Beijing was not honoring the terms of a temporary agreement and warned of further confrontation.

item.title: Why Millennials Dread Having Babies
item.description: Are millennials’ fears of failing their children outweighing their desire to have them?
